ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Trailer header and tomcat
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I d call it a missing feature. Speaking of which: do you have a client that actually *reads* trailers and does the right thing with them? BR; Julian

Keyur Shah wrote:
>  
> 
> Tomcat by default sends chunked responses => Transfer-Encoding: chunked
> 
> I'm calculating the ETag for the response dynamically as the content is 
> being written to the response stream. Since I'll know the final value of 
> the ETag only when the stream is closed, I indicate that using the 
> Trailer header => Trailer: ETag
> 
> I'm ensuring that just before the stream is closed, I set the ETag 
> header => ETag: SomeETagValue
> 
> However, when I look at the response on the client, the ETag header was 
> never written.
> 
> Is this a tomcat specific bug or am I doing something wrong?
> ...

I'd call it a missing feature.

Speaking of which: do you have a client that actually *reads* trailers 
and does the right thing with them?

BR; Julian
